jobDescription: Our mission is to make hourly work easier for local businesses and their employees. As former hourly workers ourselves, we get the struggles teams face and build our products with empathy to banish paperwork and time consuming daily tasks (like scheduling, timesheet management, or team messaging). Today, more than 60,000 local businesses rely on our collective data and expertise to better control the hours in their week and the dollars in their pocket. We are in the early stages of what we will accomplish as a company, and we are just getting started. The team brings local business expertise from Intuit, Square, OpenTable, Yelp, and First Data. Based in San Francisco and Houston, Homebase is backed by leading venture investors Baseline Ventures, Cowboy Ventures, and Khosla Ventures. At Homebase, the Data Analyst will work with the product and business teams to understand our users and give recommendations that shape the direction of our product and company. You will be our first full-time data analyst and help shape our data organization as we grow. A successful candidate will have a deep understanding of data analysis overall, be bilingual in both “business” and “data”, and will always be proactive in surfacing opportunities for the Marketing and Product teams. You will be responsible for analyzing our data, making recommendations, and coming up with long-term projects that will help us identify key areas of opportunity for the business. You will guide us to the best decisions for our users, including analyzing user engagement, measuring the results of feature deployments and marketing, and generating new user insights. What You’ll Be DoingWriting SQL to extract data from different sources and presenting that data in an easily understood way to both technical and non-technical peopleBuilding dashboards that help the teams measure and monitor the business they are bringing in and understand the health of their accountsDigging into event and log level data to find solutions to technical and business issuesThinking critically about how to best use data for driving business/product decisions QualificationsBachelors degree in Computer Science, Finance, Mathematics or related required2+ years in business intelligence and data visualizationComfortable with: SQL, Excel and visualization tools (Periscope, Tableau, Snowflake, etc), data aggregation and warehousingExperience with R and/or Python is a plus.A passion for data, analysis, and problem solvingStrong interpersonal and communication skills. Must be able to explain technical concepts and analysis clearly to a wide variety of audiencesFast-learner who is always looking to push themselves out of their comfort zone in order to expand their skills What We Can Offer YouA chance to be one of the first data analysts in a quickly growing, data-driven company backed by leading investors.Awesome data-minded co-workers with deep knowledge of and passion for our spaceThe freedom to explore projects that you think will drive the most value for our businessThe opportunity to solve real-world problems for millions of local businesses and hourly employees.Please note: relocation is NOT offered for this role. If this sounds like you, we’d love to talk. You’ll be a core member of the Homebase team as we build a great company. You’ll make life better for millions of people, and be rewarded for the great work you do.Homebase is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, national origin, religion, sex, protected veteran status, or disability.
